modules.description: This module defines command-line parameters and types for specifying input files, architectures, target platforms, and output formats in a binary analysis or translation tool. It supports concrete operations like selecting a target architecture, setting endianness, defining input/output encodings, and choosing backends or loaders. Use cases include configuring disassembly or translation pipelines with specific CPU, bit width, memory order, and output destinations.

This module enables low-level code analysis by combining disassembly, memory processing, and architecture-specific configuration with structured output generation like assembly instructions and BIL/BIR. It defines core data types for binary representations, error handling, and target validation, while its child module provides concrete configuration options for input files, architectures, endianness, and output formats. Operations include validating machine code, translating binaries across architectures, and customizing disassembly output with precise control over CPU, bit width, and memory layout. Together, they support reverse engineering, cross-platform binary analysis, and configurable translation pipelines with detailed error reporting.
